document_type: Licence Conditions and Codes of Practice (LCCP)

document_overview.purpose: Specifies operating licence conditions and codes of practice for gambling operators licensed by the UK Gambling Commission
document_overview.structure: 17 major sections covering operational, financial, and regulatory requirements
document_overview.compliance_obligation: Mandatory for all holders of UKGC operating licences
document_overview.enforcement: Breach may result in variation, suspension or revocation of licence, financial penalties, or criminal prosecution

licence_types_covered.scope: Online casino games offered to GB customers
Online bingo games offered to GB customers
Online betting on sporting events and other outcomes
Supply of gaming machines for remote gambling
Supply of gambling software to licensed operators
Provision of hosting infrastructure without direct customer contracts
Operation of lotteries by non-commercial societies or local authorities

sections.section_overview: Requirements for qualified persons in relation to small-scale operators and qualified position changes

applies_to: All operating licences except ancillary remote licences issued to small-scale operators
legal_basis: Gambling Act 2005 (Definition of Small-scale Operator) Regulations 2006

key_requirements.detail: Licensee must maintain Schedule X with list of individuals notified as qualified persons
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure Schedule X is current and accurate

key_requirements.detail: When individual begins or ceases to occupy qualifying position, apply to Commission under section 104(1)(b) within 28 days
key_requirements.compliance_action: Submit application for licence amendment within 28 days of change

key_requirements.detail: Application may be made in advance specifying effective date of change
key_requirements.compliance_action: Plan succession/departures and submit applications proactively

definitions.small_scale_operator: Operator meeting specific criteria in Gambling Act 2005 (Definition of Small-scale Operator) Regulations 2006
definitions.qualifying_position: As defined in Gambling Act 2005 (Definition of Small-scale Operator) Regulations 2006
definitions.qualified_person: Individual meeting qualification criteria and notified to Commission

conditions.penalties_for_breach: Variation, suspension or revocation of operating licence

conditions.condition_title: Specified management offices – personal management licences
Specified management offices – casino personal functional licences
Specified management offices – lottery personal management licences

sections.section_title: Technical Standards, Equipment Specifications, Remote Gambling Equipment and Gambling Software
sections.section_overview: Requirements for technical standards, gambling software, equipment inspection, and RTS compliance

applies_to: All remote casino, bingo and betting licences except ancillary licences and remote betting intermediary (trading room only) licences
legal_basis: Gambling Act 2005 section 51-54 (gambling software definition and offences)

key_requirements.detail: All gambling software must be manufactured by holder of gambling software operating licence
key_requirements.compliance_action: Verify supplier holds UKGC gambling software operating licence

key_requirements.detail: All gambling software must be supplied to licensee by holder of gambling software operating licence
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure supply chain uses licensed operators only

key_requirements.detail: Software must only be installed or adapted by holder of gambling software operating licence
key_requirements.compliance_action: Contractually require licensed operator to perform installation/adaptation

statutory_definition.meaning: Computer software for use in connection with remote gambling, but does not include anything for use solely in connection with a gaming machine
statutory_definition.offences: Person commits offence if manufactures, supplies, installs or adapts gambling software without operating licence
penalties: Fine not exceeding level 5 on standard scale

applies_to: All non-remote gaming machine technical and gambling software licences and remote operating licences, including remote gaming machine technical, remote gambling software and betting ancillary remote licences, but not remote betting intermediary (trading rooms only) licences

key_requirements.detail: Licensees must comply with Commission's technical standards and requirements for timing and procedures for testing
key_requirements.compliance_action: Reference rts-01 to rts-17 JSON files in this MCP; implement required testing procedures

sections.section_title: Peer to Peer Gaming, Other Networks and Hosting
sections.section_overview: Requirements for peer-to-peer gaming networks, network operators, and hosting arrangements

applies_to: Remote casino licences (except ancillary remote and casino game host licences)

key_requirements.detail: Every player in Great Britain must have contract with network operator or another UKGC remote casino licensed operator
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure all GB players have valid contracts on file

key_requirements.detail: International players must have contracts with network operator, licensed UKGC operator, or approved unlicensed operator
key_requirements.compliance_action: Approve international operators after due diligence; verify licensing and AML compliance

key_requirements.detail: Arrangements with other operators must clearly specify responsibility for complaint categories, particularly multi-jurisdiction disputes
key_requirements.compliance_action: Document dispute handling protocols with all partner operators

key_requirements.detail: Policies and procedures must meet requirements equivalent to Third Money Laundering Directive (2005/60/EC) or successor
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement KYC/AML procedures meeting EU directive standards

key_requirements.detail: Arrangements must enable parties to discharge regulatory obligations including money laundering prevention, terrorism financing prevention, cheating investigation, problem gambling combating, customer complaint investigation
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish information sharing protocols with all network partners

applies_to: All remote casino, bingo and betting licences except ancillary remote and host licences
conditions.note: Does not apply to provision of facilities for playing non-remote bingo games in premises with bingo premises licence

key_requirements.detail: Every domestic customer must contract with network operator or another UKGC licence holder of same type
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure contractual relationships cover all domestic customers

key_requirements.detail: Clear arrangements for which operator handles which complaint categories
key_requirements.compliance_action: Document and communicate dispute handling process

key_requirements.detail: Enable regulatory compliance for money laundering, terrorism financing, cheating investigation, problem gambling, complaints
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish and maintain information sharing agreements

applies_to: All casino (game host), bingo (game host), general betting (host) (real events) and general betting (host) (virtual events) licences

key_requirements.detail: Hosts must ensure participants (domestic and international) are parties to appropriate contracts with licensed operators
key_requirements.compliance_action: Verify contractual arrangements between host and participating operators

sections.section_overview: Requirements for customer fund protection, segregation, and insolvency protection

applies_to: All operating licences holding customer funds

key_requirements.detail: Customer funds must be held in separate client bank account(s)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish dedicated segregated bank accounts for customer funds

key_requirements.detail: Includes all customer account balances, deposits received, accumulated winnings awaiting withdrawal, and prize funds
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure all customer money is tracked and segregated

applies_to: All operating licences holding customer funds

key_requirements.detail: Terms must clearly state whether customer funds are protected in insolvency, level of protection, and method of achievement
key_requirements.compliance_action: Provide written disclosure to customers with acknowledgement

key_requirements.detail: Information must be provided before first deposit and upon any changes, requiring customer acknowledgement
key_requirements.compliance_action: Obtain customer acknowledgement of insolvency protection information

sections.section_overview: Requirements for payment methods and cash/cash equivalent handling

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Accept payments only from FCA-authorised payment service providers or equivalent regulated entities
key_requirements.compliance_action: Verify payment provider licensing under Payment Services Regulations 2017

applies_to: All remote casino, bingo and betting operating licences, except ancillary, host and remote betting intermediary (trading room only) licences

key_requirements.detail: Accept payments only from FCA-authorised payment service providers as defined in Schedule 1 Part 1 of Payment Services Regulations 2017 (SI 2017 No 752)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Verify all payment providers hold required 'payment service provider' designation under regulation 2

key_requirements.detail: This condition applies from 31 January 2024
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure compliance from specified effective date

sections.section_title: Provision of Credit by Licensees and the Use of Credit Cards
sections.section_overview: Requirements prohibiting credit provision and credit card acceptance

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Licensees must not provide credit to customers for gambling
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure systems prevent credit extension to customers

key_requirements.detail: Must not accept credit card payments, including through money service businesses
key_requirements.compliance_action: Block credit card payments in payment processing systems

applies_to: All non-remote general betting, pool betting and betting intermediary licences, and all remote licences (including ancillary remote betting and ancillary remote lottery licences) except gaming machine technical, gambling software and host licences

key_requirements.detail: Licensees must not accept payment for gambling by credit card
key_requirements.compliance_action: Block credit card transactions in payment processing systems

key_requirements.detail: This includes payments made through money service businesses
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure payment processors do not accept credit card payments via intermediaries

sections.section_overview: Requirements for fair terms, transparent practices, and consumer protection compliance

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Ensure terms and consumer notices are not unfair under Consumer Rights Act 2015
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review terms for fairness; comply with Act requirements

key_requirements.detail: Changes to customer contract terms must comply with Consumer Rights Act 2015 fairness and transparency requirements
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify customers of material changes before implementation

key_requirements.detail: Do not commit unfair commercial practices under Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations 2008
key_requirements.compliance_action: Train staff on unfair practices; implement compliance monitoring

sections.section_overview: Requirements for displaying Commission licence information on gambling platforms

applies_to: All remote operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Display Commission statement and account number on every screen where customers can access gambling
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement display in technical systems per Commission specification

key_requirements.detail: Display must follow format and contain information specified by Commission in technical standards
key_requirements.compliance_action: Reference applicable RTS standards for display format

conditions.condition_title: Display of licensed status – B2B operators
applies_to: All gaming machine technical, gambling software and host licences

key_requirements.detail: Display the following on the first page of website offering gaming machines or gambling software: statement of UKGC licensing, account number, link to licensed status on Commission website
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement display on first page of B2B website

key_requirements.detail: Display at least the above information on each page offering gaming machines or gambling software
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure display on all relevant pages

key_requirements.detail: Where offering products not provided under licence, clearly distinguish regulated from unregulated products
key_requirements.compliance_action: Mark products clearly as regulated or unregulated

key_requirements.detail: Statement, account number and link must be in format specified by Commission in technical standards
key_requirements.compliance_action: Follow Commission technical standards for display format

conditions.condition_title: Display of licensed status – societies and local authorities
applies_to: All lottery operating licences issued to non-commercial societies, local authorities and external lottery managers

key_requirements.detail: Display on every screen from which customers can access lottery products: statement of UKGC licensing, account number, link to licensed status on Commission website
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement display on all lottery access screens

key_requirements.detail: Statement, account number and link must be in format specified by Commission
key_requirements.compliance_action: Follow Commission specifications for display format

sections.section_title: Types and Rules of Casino and Other Games
sections.section_overview: Requirements regarding permitted games and gaming rules

applies_to: All non-remote casino operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Do not offer games on Commission prohibited list
key_requirements.compliance_action: Check Commission-published prohibited games list; restrict prohibited games

key_requirements.detail: Operators free to offer new casino games without approval (none currently prohibited)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Inform Commission if new games introduced

applies_to: All non-remote bingo operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Follow rules for bingo games and prize games
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure compliance with specified bingo game rules

sections.section_overview: Requirements for tipping arrangements in casinos using tronc systems

applies_to: All non-remote casino operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Tips only permitted through tronc system where all tips pooled and distributed to employees
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement tronc system; maintain tipping records

key_requirements.detail: Separate tronc may operate for each staff category
key_requirements.compliance_action: Design tronc structure to match staff categories

sections.section_overview: Requirements for lottery operations by non-commercial societies, local authorities, and external lottery managers

conditions.condition_title: Lotteries - Non-Commercial Societies and Local Authorities
applies_to: All lottery operating licences issued to non-commercial societies or local authorities

key_requirements.detail: At least 20% of lottery proceeds applied to society purpose or LA statutory power
key_requirements.compliance_action: Track proceeds; allocate minimum 20% to qualifying purpose

key_requirements.detail: Single lottery max £5,000,000; aggregate annual proceeds max £50,000,000
key_requirements.compliance_action: Monitor cumulative proceeds; ensure within limits

key_requirements.detail: Individual ticket maximum: £25,000 or 10% of proceeds (whichever greater)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Set prize limits in lottery rules; validate payments

key_requirements.detail: Cannot link to other lotteries unless max aggregate win under £500,000
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review linkage arrangements; ensure compliance

key_requirements.detail: Each ticket must identify: promoting society, designated member's name/address, draw date(s)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Include required information on tickets

key_requirements.detail: Tickets must display 'licensed by Gambling Commission' and Commission website details
key_requirements.compliance_action: Include on all ticket formats

key_requirements.detail: Ticket price must be: uniform, shown on ticket, paid before ticket issue
key_requirements.compliance_action: Set and display ticket price; enforce payment before issue

key_requirements.detail: Lodge description and rules with Commission at least 28 days before sale
key_requirements.compliance_action: Submit lottery documentation 28 days pre-sale

key_requirements.detail: Cannot sell in street except from static structures (kiosk) or door-to-door; requires local authority permission
key_requirements.compliance_action: Restrict street sales; obtain local authority permissions

key_requirements.detail: Records must show: total proceeds, prize allocation, expenses, amount applied to purpose, sold/unsold ticket count
key_requirements.compliance_action: Maintain detailed accounting; retain 3 years

key_requirements.detail: Within 3 months of draw, submit lottery submission with accounting information and approval by qualified person
key_requirements.compliance_action: Submit within 3-month deadline; obtain required approvals

key_requirements.detail: If annual proceeds exceed £1,000,000, provide auditor confirmation that proceeds fully accounted for in annual accounts
key_requirements.compliance_action: Obtain auditor confirmation if threshold exceeded

applies_to: All lottery operating licences issued to external lottery managers

key_requirements.detail: At least 20% of proceeds paid to promoting society/LA for qualifying purpose
key_requirements.compliance_action: Calculate and pay minimum 20% proceeds share

key_requirements.detail: Single lottery max £5,000,000; aggregate per society/LA max £50,000,000
key_requirements.compliance_action: Manage proceeds within limits per society

key_requirements.detail: Individual maximum: £25,000 or 10% of proceeds
key_requirements.compliance_action: Set per rules; validate in system

key_requirements.detail: Lottery proceeds segregated from trading income; held in trustee bank account for each society/LA; protected in event of insolvency
key_requirements.compliance_action: Maintain separate trustee accounts per society; document arrangements

key_requirements.detail: Procedures to ensure lottery profits properly allocated and accounted to society/LA promptly
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish and follow profit allocation procedures

key_requirements.detail: All other requirements apply (non-linked, documentation, street sales restrictions, accounting, submission)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement all applicable lottery requirements

sections.section_overview: Requirements for AML risk assessment, policies, procedures, and terrorist financing prevention

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Assess risks of business being used for money laundering and terrorist financing
key_requirements.compliance_action: Complete risk assessment; document findings

key_requirements.detail: Review as necessary in light of changes in circumstances, products, technology, payment methods, customer demographic; review at least annually
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish annual review cycle; update when circumstances change

key_requirements.detail: Ensure appropriate policies, procedures and controls to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement risk-based AML/CFT controls

key_requirements.detail: Controls must be implemented effectively, kept under review, revised appropriately to remain effective; account for Commission guidance
key_requirements.compliance_action: Monitor control effectiveness; update per Commission guidance

conditions.condition_title: Anti-money laundering - Measures for operators based in foreign jurisdictions

sections.section_overview: Requirements for pool betting record-keeping on horserace and football pools

conditions.condition_title: Pool Betting - Horserace and Dog Race
applies_to: All pool betting operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Produce and retain record of transactions relevant to each pool offered
key_requirements.compliance_action: Maintain transaction records enabling identification of individual bets and winnings

key_requirements.detail: Records must be available to Commission on request
key_requirements.compliance_action: Maintain accessible records for Commission inspection

applies_to: All pool betting operating licences which authorise football pools

key_requirements.detail: Licensees and any authorised person under section 93(3) Gambling Act 2005 must produce and retain record of transactions for each pool offered
key_requirements.compliance_action: Maintain comprehensive transaction records

key_requirements.detail: Record must be capable of identifying individual bets into pool and relating to subsequent payment of winnings
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement system tracking individual bets and associated winnings

key_requirements.detail: Records must be made available to Commission on request
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure records accessible for Commission inspection

applies_to: All pool betting operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Licensees must produce annual accounts
key_requirements.compliance_action: Prepare annual financial statements

key_requirements.detail: Accounts should be certified by qualified independent accountant
key_requirements.compliance_action: Engage qualified accountant to certify accounts

key_requirements.detail: Copies must be made available to Commission on request
key_requirements.compliance_action: Provide copies to Commission when requested

sections.section_overview: Enforcement officer access rights to premises

applies_to: All non-remote operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Permit enforcement officers access to premises for inspection and enforcement purposes
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish access procedures for Commission officers

sections.section_overview: Detailed reporting requirements for key events, other reportable events, and regulatory returns

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: As soon as reasonably practicable, provide information relating to suspected offences under Gambling Act 2005
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish reporting procedures for suspected offences

conditions.condition_title: Reporting suspicion of offences etc – betting licences
applies_to: All betting operating licences including betting intermediary, ancillary remote betting, betting host and remote betting intermediary (trading rooms only) licences

key_requirements.detail: As soon as reasonably practicable, provide Commission with any information from whatever source that licensee knows relates to or suspects may relate to commission of offence under the Act
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish procedures for reporting suspected offences

key_requirements.detail: Report information relating to offence resulting from breach of licence condition or code provision
key_requirements.compliance_action: Monitor for potential licence condition breaches

key_requirements.detail: Report information suspected to relate to section 336 Gambling Act 2005 bet voiding orders
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report suspected situations warranting bet void orders

key_requirements.detail: Licensees accepting bets on outcomes of sporting events governed by bodies in Schedule 6 Part 3 Gambling Act 2005 must report relevant information to that governing body as soon as reasonably practicable
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report suspected betting rule breaches to relevant sport governing body

key_requirements.detail: Betting rules include any rule about bets that would be regulated activities under Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (spread betting)
key_requirements.compliance_action: Include spread betting in scope of reporting obligations

conditions.condition_title: Reporting of systematic or organised money lending
applies_to: All non-remote casino, non-remote bingo, general betting, adult gaming centre, family entertainment centre and remote betting intermediary (trading rooms only) licences

key_requirements.detail: As soon as reasonably practicable provide Commission with information relating to cases of systematic, organised or substantial money lending between customers on premises
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement monitoring procedures for customer-to-customer lending activity

key_requirements.detail: Reporting in accordance with ordinary code provisions on money lending between customers
key_requirements.compliance_action: Align reporting with code of practice requirements

key_requirements.detail: Reporting in such form or manner as Commission may specify from time to time
key_requirements.compliance_action: Follow Commission reporting format requirements

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Report changes to governing documents, articles of association, regulatory structure
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify of governance/regulatory changes

key_requirements.detail: Report changes in beneficial ownership (>=20%) and holding company interests
key_requirements.compliance_action: Track and report ownership changes

key_requirements.detail: Report senior manager, MLRO, nominated officer departures/appointments; disciplinary sanctions for gross misconduct
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report personnel changes within required timeframes

key_requirements.detail: Report commencement of material litigation and outcome
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify of significant lawsuits

key_requirements.detail: Report disclosures under Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 or Terrorism Act 2000 with unique reference number
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report SARs with reference number within 5 working days

key_requirements.detail: Report security breaches affecting customer data confidentiality or account access >12 hours
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report cyber incidents affecting operations or data

key_requirements.detail: Report system faults causing under/overpayments or incorrect prizes
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report system errors affecting player payouts

key_requirements.detail: Report commencement/cessation of trading on website domains, mobile apps, or broadcast media
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify of new or closed operational channels

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Report material changes to customer funds protection arrangements
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify of changes to segregated accounts or security

key_requirements.detail: Report changes to dispute resolution provider
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify of ADR provider changes

key_requirements.detail: Report awareness of unlicensed group companies advertising in new jurisdictions or exceeding GGY thresholds
key_requirements.compliance_action: Monitor group advertising; report threshold breaches

key_requirements.detail: Report actual or potential breaches of Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 or Terrorism Act 2000
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report potential money laundering/terrorist financing breaches

key_requirements.detail: Notify if player death by suicide known or suspected, including name, DOB, gambling activity summary
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report suspected suicide deaths with available player information

conditions.condition_title: Other Reportable Events - Money Laundering, Terrorist Financing
applies_to: All non-remote and remote casino operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Notify of actual or potential breaches of Money Laundering, Terrorist Financing and Transfer of Funds (Information on Payer) Regulations 2017
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report breaches within required timeframes

key_requirements.detail: Within 14 days of appointment, notify Commission of individual responsible for MLRTF compliance
key_requirements.compliance_action: Provide name and contact details of AML officer

key_requirements.detail: Within 14 days of appointment, notify Commission of nominated officer
key_requirements.compliance_action: Provide details of nominated officer

key_requirements.detail: Within 14 days of departure/removal of AML officer or nominated officer, notify Commission
key_requirements.compliance_action: Report staff departures in AML/NOM roles

applies_to: All operating licences

key_requirements.detail: Provide Commission with any information on facilities use and gambling operations as requested
key_requirements.compliance_action: Maintain records enabling compliance with information requests

key_requirements.detail: Within 28 days of end of each quarterly period, submit accurate Regulatory Return with specified information
key_requirements.compliance_action: Submit quarterly returns within 28-day deadline

sections.section_overview: Requirements for responsible ad placement avoiding copyright infringement

applies_to: All licences

key_requirements.detail: Do not place digital advertisements on websites providing unauthorised access to copyrighted content
key_requirements.compliance_action: Screen ad placement partners; avoid piracy sites

key_requirements.detail: Take reasonable steps to ensure third parties do not place adverts on copyright infringement websites
key_requirements.compliance_action: Contract terms require third parties to avoid piracy sites; monitor placement

key_requirements.detail: Contracts must enable prompt termination if third party places ads on copyright infringement sites
key_requirements.compliance_action: Include termination clauses in third party contracts

sections.section_overview: Requirements for customer identity verification and information retention

applies_to: All remote licences (including ancillary remote betting licences in respect of bets by telephone or email), except lottery, gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote casino, and ancillary remote bingo

key_requirements.detail: Obtain and verify information establishing customer identity (name, address, date of birth) before customer gambles
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement KYC procedures; verify identity before account activation

key_requirements.requirement: No withdrawal restrictions for early information
key_requirements.detail: Withdrawal requests must not require additional information if could have been requested earlier
key_requirements.compliance_action: Gather identity information upfront; allow unrestricted withdrawals

key_requirements.detail: Inform customers pre-deposit about identity documents/information that may be required and circumstances
key_requirements.compliance_action: Provide clear information on identity requirements before deposit

key_requirements.detail: Take reasonable steps to ensure identity information remains accurate and current
key_requirements.compliance_action: Periodically update and verify customer identity information
